instructions:
In a 2-quart saucepan, mix tomato paste with small amounts of water and stir until smooth and all water
has been added. Stir in the enchilada sauce mix and sugar. Bring to a slow boil and simmer with cover
slightly ajar for 15 minutes.
Set aside 1/2 of the sauce to be used below, and freeze the remaining half of the sauce for next time.

ENCHALADA PREPARATION
1/2 of the sauce from above recipe
1/2 lb ground beef
4 corn taco shells
1 cup *(4 oz)* shredded Cheddar cheese

Brown the ground beef in an 8 inch skillet and then add 1/4 cup of the sauce, simmer for a couple of
minutes and set aside. Spread 1/2 cup of the sauce over the bottom of a 6 x 9 inch Pyrex baking dish. Divide
the prepared meat into quarters and spoon into the 4 taco shells. Place each filled shell onto the sauce in the
baking dish. Gently push down on the top of each shell until it breaks. Pour the remaining sauce over the
shells and then sprinkle the shredded cheese. Cover tightly with foil and bake in a 350 F oven for 30
minutes. Serves 2.
ingredients: 1 pkg el Rio enchilada sauce mix
name: Enchaladas
